title: 25 Types of Content You Can Use for Content Marketing
description: In content marketing, there are heaps of options to pick from. To make it easier, we've curated 25 types for your choosing pleasure.
content: Si Quan Ong Content marketer @ Ahrefs. I've been in digital marketing for the past 6 years and have spoken at some of the industry‚Äôs largest conferences in Asia (TIECon and Digital Marketing Skill Share.) I also write about my curiosities on my Substack. Get the week's best marketing content Email Subscription Subscribe Leave this field empty if you're human: Contents What type of content should you create for your content marketing?From blog posts to memes, learn the 25 different types of content you can use for your content marketing strategy.Contents1. Blog postsBlog posts are a great way to educate your audience and ‚Äúsell‚Äù what you do in the process.ExampleOur list of free keyword research tools features four of our own tools.How to market themIf you want consistent traffic to your blog posts, write about topics people search for on Google and use SEO to rank high.How can you find these topics?Look at which of your competitors‚Äô posts get the most organic search traffic.Here‚Äôs how:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Site ExplorerEnter a popular industry blogGo to the Top pages reportToggle SERP titles on Further readingHow to Write a Blog Post (That People Actually Want to Read) in 9 Steps 2. VideosVideos are a great way to reach a wide audience and show your product or service in action.ExampleOur video on lesser-known link building tactics shows how you can execute them with the help of our toolset.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B5jmQig8FJUHow to market themIf you‚Äôre starting out with no audience, the best way to generate traffic to your videos is to rank high on YouTube. You can do this by targeting topics people are searching for on YouTube.Here‚Äôs how to find these topics:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerSwitch the tab to YouTubeEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportFurther readingYouTube SEO: How to Rank Your Videos From Start to Finish 3. PodcastsPodcasts are a great way to build brand awareness, reach a wide audience, and network with industry experts.ExampleIn only six months, HubSpot‚Äôs ‚ÄúMarketing Against the Grain‚Äù podcast hit 70,000 monthly downloads‚Äîmany of whom are marketers and potential customers. How to market themA few ideas to get the word out for your podcast:Record your podcast as a video so it can be uploaded on YouTube (instead of just having it in audio)Share snippets of your podcast on social media (here‚Äôs an example)Be a guest on other podcastsTranscribe your podcast and send highlights to journalists 4. How-tosHow-tos are a great way to teach your audience to solve problems step by step with your product or service.ExampleOur article on keyword optimization shows how to complete the process with our toolset.How to market themThe best way is to rank your how-tos on Google and generate consistent search traffic. To do this, target ‚Äúhow to‚Äù keywords.Here‚Äôs how to find them:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äúhow‚Äù5. GuidesGuides are a great way to introduce your audience to a specific topic and insert your product or service in the process.ExampleOur beginner‚Äôs guide to technical SEO explains everything you need to know about technical SEO, including how to use our toolset to fix technical issues.How to market themThe best way is to rank your guides high on Google. Here‚Äôs how to find guide-related topics:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äúwhat‚ÄùSidenote. Not all of this will be guide-related keywords (e.g., ‚Äúwhat does seo stand for‚Äù), so make sure you analyze the SERPs first.6. NewslettersNewsletters are a great way to build an audience whom you can reach out to any time. They‚Äôre also great for distributing content.ExampleWe send a weekly newsletter to 200,000 people that features content from our blog and elsewhere.How to market themThe best way is to encourage people to opt in for the newsletter when they‚Äôre already consuming your content. You can do this via a simple opt-in (like us) or with an incentive (via the other content formats in this post).Further reading8 Easy (But Effective) Ways to Grow Your Email List 7. ListiclesDon‚Äôt just riff off a list of items; expand your listicles with specific steps. This will allow you to ‚Äúsell‚Äù your product or service naturally.ExampleOur listicle on driving traffic to your website shows how you can use our toolset in different tactics.How to market themLike other blog post formats, the best way is to rank your listicle high on Google. Here‚Äôs how to find potential list-based topics:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add list-based keywords like ‚Äúideas, tips, tools, things, strategies, tactics, list‚ÄùFurther readingHow to Write a Great Listicle Post in 10 Steps 8. EbooksUsually <100 pages, ebooks work as great incentives to encourage visitors to opt in to your email list.ExampleTo get a free copy of Intercom‚Äôs book on marketing, it requires prospects to fill in relevant details (e.g., name, email address, and more).How to market themCreate a dedicated landing page for your ebook that‚Äôs designed to capture email addresses. You can then link to this landing page from your blog posts or run ads to it.9. Physical booksPhysical books are generally regarded as high-value and signal that the brand is serious about content and education.ExampleThe launch of our new SEO book for beginners generated a positive reception. https://twitter.com/r_betelgeuse/status/1649409619951845378How to market themThe best way to market a book is word of mouth. To get the flywheel going, run a giveaway of your book.We‚Äôve published an SEO book for beginners‚Äîand we‚Äôve 100 hardcover copies to give away! ü•≥To score a copy:1Ô∏è‚É£ Like + RT this post2Ô∏è‚É£ Leave a comment telling us when + why you started learning SEO**Note: This giveaway closes April 15, 12am EST. Good luck!** pic.twitter.com/COCfOFPdKi‚Äî Ahrefs (@ahrefs) April 11, 2023 10. ChecklistsChecklists are a great way to drive tons of search traffic and insert your product or service as part of the checklist. They can also work well as a content upgrade.ExampleOur SEO checklist ranks in position #2 and generates a lot of search traffic.How to market themThe best way is to rank your checklist high on Google. Here‚Äôs how to find potential checklist topics:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äúchecklist‚Äù11. TemplatesLike checklists, templates are a good way to ‚Äúinsert‚Äù your product or service into the process. They also work well as lead magnets.ExampleOur guide to keyword strategy offers a free template for anyone to copy.How to market themDon‚Äôt create templates no one wants. Make sure people are looking for it. You can do this by looking for templates people are searching for.Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äútemplate‚Äù12. White papersSince the goal of a white paper is to show necessary data and facts to explain why a product is the best on the market, it can work as a lead magnet for prospects who are interested in learning more about your product.ExampleUltimaker, a 3D printer manufacturer, gathers contact information from an audience interested in the real cost of owning a 3D printer.How to market themCreate a dedicated landing page for your white paper. You can then link to this landing page from your blog posts or run ads to it.13. Social media postsSocial media posts are great for increasing brand awareness, reaching a broader audience, and building a following interested in your brand, content, product, or service.ExampleAhrefs posts regularly on Twitter, including threads.Find low-competition keywords in 3 steps üîçBuilding a new website and looking to strengthen your link profile? Capture low-hanging keywords.You can find them using an SEO tool featuring a difficulty score‚Äîlike Ahrefs‚Äô Keyword Difficulty.Follow these steps üëá‚Äî Ahrefs (@ahrefs) April 10, 2023 How to market themEach social media platform has its own rules, culture, and media type (e.g., short-form videos on TikTok, carousels on LinkedIn, long-form on Twitter). Learn what they are and create content that matches what people on the platform want to see.14. Illustrations and infographicsIllustrations and infographics are great ways to condense text, concepts, and ideas into a shareable form. They also work great on social media.ExampleOur post on how to get on the first page of Google features a flowchart.How to market themCreate illustrations and infographics that people want to see. You can do this by following the TRUST formula:Find a Trending topicDo Research and analysis to find interesting dataPresent a Unique takeaway Create a Simple visualPromote TacticallyFurther readingHow to Get High-Quality Backlinks With the TRUST Formula [Case Study] 15. ToolsFree tools are a great way to let customers test-drive your product or service.ExampleOur backlink checker is one of the many free SEO tools we offer.How to market themDon‚Äôt guess what tools people want. Create them based on what people are searching for:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äútool, tools, checker, calculator‚Äù16. CoursesCourses are a great way to educate your audience, especially about how to use your product or use your product to solve their problems.ExampleOur SEO course for beginners teaches the basics of SEO using Ahrefs.How to market themSimilarly, you‚Äôll want to create courses for topics that people are searching for:Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords ExplorerEnter one or a few relevant keywordsGo to the Matching terms reportIn the Include filter, add ‚Äúcourse‚Äù17. Case studiesCase studies can be an effective nudge for turning a prospect into a customer.ExampleRecruiting software Lever has hundreds of case studies based on customer size and industry.How to market themThe best way is to add them to your website so visitors can navigate there.They can also be used as part of your sales process.18. TestimonialsTestimonials are a great way to add social proof to your website.ExampleWe have a rolling carousel of testimonials on our homepage, separated by our customer profiles.How to market themThe best way is to put them on your homepage.19. WebinarsWebinars are a great way to generate leads or onboard customers.ExampleWe mainly use webinars as onboarding at Ahrefs.How to market themThe specific promotion strategy will depend on your goals for webinars:If you‚Äôre using them as onboarding for new or existing customers, you can promote them via your email list.If you‚Äôre using them for lead generation, consider partnering with experts and influencers in your niche so they can promote them to various audiences.Further readingHow ConvertKit Grew From $98K to $625K MRR by Doing 150 Webinars in 1 Year 20. QuizzesQuizzes are a great way to acquire links, build brand awareness, and segment your audience.ExampleTodoist runs a quiz on the best productivity methods.How to market themAdd them to your website so visitors can navigate and find them.21. Interactive contentInteractive forms of content, like games, allow prospects and customers to play with content. They‚Äôre a great type of content to attract backlinks.ExampleSwedish financial company Advisa created a game to indirectly comment on the British pound after Brexit was confirmed.How to market themThe best way is to pitch your interactive content to relevant news websites. Further readingDigital PR: The Beginner‚Äôs Guide to Making Your Brand Unmissable9 Great Public Relations Tactics With Campaign Examples 22. InterviewsInterviews are a great way to create expert content and tap into other people‚Äôs audiences. They can be in any format: video, audio, or text.ExampleOur chief marketing officer, Tim Soulo, interviews expert SEOs and marketers for our customers-only community:How to market themPromote your interview via your email list. You should also encourage your guest to promote the interview to their audience.23. Slide decksSlide decks are usually created for conferences and work well as thought leadership. ExampleThis is a presentation from Tim at BrightonSEO, an SEO conference. Rethinking The Fundamentals of Keyword Research With The Insights From Big Data by Tim Soulo, Ahrefs from AhrefsHow to market themAfter your presentation, upload your slide decks on SlideShare.24. MemesPrimarily for social media, memes are a great way to engage with your audience.ExampleFast-food restaurant Wendy‚Äôs is well known for posting memes on Twitter.pic.twitter.com/mZzgtv9uEi‚Äî Wendy‚Äôs (@Wendys) September 14, 2022 How to market themSince memes are mainly for engaging with your audience, the best way is to post them on the social media platform you‚Äôre using to engage with said audience.25. User-generated contentUser-generated content (UGC) is a great way to build and engage with your audience.ExampleEvery post and reply in our customers-only community is UGC and contributes to its engagement and activity.How to market themRather than market UGC, a better way would be to figure out how to generate more of it. For example, we‚Äôd want more activity in our community (and therefore more UGC).While there‚Äôs no surefire way to do this, one thing‚Äôs certain‚Äîyou have to be a brand that your customers love. That means creating an amazing product and providing great customer service.Beyond that, you‚Äôll also want to make things exclusive so your customers feel like they‚Äôre part of an invite-only community. For example:Our interview series, ‚ÄúThis Never Happened,‚Äù is live, and the recording is only available to our community for 24 hours.Adidas Yeezys are limited edition, and you can‚Äôt get them anywhere else.To launch his chocolate brand, Feastables, MrBeast embedded 10 golden tickets that represent the opportunity to be featured in a MrBeast video, remaking Willy Wonka‚Äôs Chocolate Factory in real life.Learn moreLooking to learn more about content marketing?
